sentences.text: PerkinElmer, Inc., also referred to as we, us, the Company or PerkinElmer, has prepared this proxy statement to provide our shareholders with information pertaining to the matters to be voted on at our annual meeting of shareholders to be held on Tuesday, April 25, 2017 at 8:00 a.m., at our corporate offices, located at 940 Winter Street, Waltham, Massachusetts 02451, and at any adjournment of that meeting.

sentences.text: In considering whether to recommend any candidate for inclusion in the board of directors slate of recommended director nominees, including candidates recommended by shareholders, the nominating and corporate governance committee will apply the criteria set forth in PerkinElmers corporate governance guidelines and such other factors as the committee deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These criteria include the candidates experience, skills, and independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating a candidates experience and skills, the nominating and corporate governance committee may also consider qualities such as an understanding of technologies, marketing, finance, regulation and public policy, and international issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating a candidates independence, the nominating and corporate governance committee will consider the applicable independence standards of the NYSE and the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominating and corporate governance committee will evaluate each director candidate in the context of the perceived needs of the board, the best interests of PerkinElmer and its shareholders, as well as our corporate governance guidelines which specify that the composition of the board should reflect diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the nominating and corporate governance committee seeks nominees with a broad range of experience, professions, skills and backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominating and corporate governance committee does not assign specific weights to particular criteria, and no particular criterion is necessarily applicable to all prospective nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the backgrounds and qualifications of the directors, considered as a group, should provide a significant composite mix of experience, knowledge and abilities that will allow our board to fulfill its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors selects a Chairman of the board by evaluating the criteria and using a process that the board considers to be in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders, pursuant to our corporate governance guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors has an active role in overseeing risks that could affect the Company, including operational, financial, legal and regulatory, and strategic and reputational risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This oversight is conducted primarily through the audit committee, which has been assigned responsibility for enterprise risk management and reports regularly to our board on such matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior management carries out the functional performance of enterprise risk management activities, with access to external service providers as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process includes periodic reporting by management to the audit committee in order to systematically identify, analyze, prioritize and document potential business risks, their potential impact on the Companys performance, and the Companys ability to detect, manage, control and prevent these risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the audit committee receives a report from senior management, the Chair of the audit committee reports on the discussion to the full board during the next board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This enables the board and its committees to coordinate the overall risk oversight role, particularly with respect to risk areas that may potentially impact more than one committee of the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain Relationships and Policies on Related Party Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominating and corporate governance committee of our board of directors has adopted written policies and procedures for the review of any transaction, arrangement or relationship in which PerkinElmer was or is to be a participant, and in which one of our executive officers, directors, director nominees or 5% stockholders (or their immediate family members), or any entity in which persons listed above, either individually or in the aggregate, has a greater than 10% ownership interest, each of whom we refer to as a related party, has or will have a direct or indirect material interest, as determined by the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to these transactions as related party transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy calls for any proposed related party transaction to be reviewed and, if deemed appropriate, approved by our nominating and corporate governance committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whenever practicable, the review and approval will occur prior to entry into the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If advance approval is not practicable, the committee will review, and, in its discretion, may approve the related party transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also permits the Chair of the committee to review and, if deemed appropriate, approve proposed related party transactions that arise between committee meetings, in which case the Chair will report such transactions to the committee at its next meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any related party transactions that are ongoing in nature will be reviewed annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will review and consider such information regarding the related party transaction as it deems appropriate under the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has determined that certain types of transactions, such as those excluded by the instructions to the Securities and Exchange Commissions related person transaction disclosure rule, do not create a material direct or indirect interest on behalf of related parties and, therefore, are not related party transactions for purposes of this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may approve a related party transaction only if the committee determines that, under all of the circumstances, the transaction is in the best interest of PerkinElmer and its shareholders.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PerkinElmer is a global leader in the diagnostic, research and environmental markets, focused on innovating for a healthier world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We operate in scientific, fast-paced, ever-evolving markets in which there is a high level of competition for market share and limited talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goals of our executive compensation program are to attract, retain and motivate talented executives to enable the Company to be successful in a highly competitive environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The structure of our executive compensation program supports our business strategy by driving top-line growth while remaining focused on profitability, cash flow performance and increased operating productivity, and creating sustainable market positions for our products, technology and services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this enhances the value of our shareholders investment and, over time, will generate sustainable shareholder value through stock price appreciation and dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is a robust, highly performance-driven program intended to generate both long-term sustainable shareholder value and near-term focus on financial performance, operational excellence, quality and innovation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this through two primary incentive vehicles in addition to base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, to address short-term performance, we have an annual cash incentive plan that we call our Performance Incentive Plan, or PIP, which we also refer to as our short-term incentive program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PIP payments are made based on achievement against pre-defined financial targets, which for fiscal year 2016 included free cash flow and adjusted earnings per share, or adjusted EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We define free cash flow as operating cash flow less capital expenditures adjusted for significant items, and we define adjusted EPS as earnings per share adjusted for the impact of items related to acquisitions, business repositioning, mark to market on post-retirement benefits and certain other items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PIP operates on a single performance period comprising the full fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, our executive officers participate in our Long-Term Incentive Program, or LTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTIP is structured with overlapping three-year performance cycles and in 2016 included three diverse incentive vehicles: restricted stock, performance units (a cash plan that ties vesting and payment to the achievement of financial goals) and stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three- year performance goals in our LTIP are aligned with our strategic planning process and are designed to focus our executives on making and executing decisions that drive growth and create lasting shareholder value.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Philosophy and Core Principles: Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We apply the following compensation philosophy in structuring the compensation of our executive officers, including the named xecutive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that pay should be performance-based, vary with the attainment of specific objectives, and be closely ligned with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To implement this philosophy, the committee, working with management and the ommittees compensation consultant, has established core principles to guide the design and operation of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We aim to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide market-competitive compensation to attract and retain executive talent with the capability to lead within a global company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: emphasize variable pay to align executive compensation with the achievement of results that drive PerkinElmers business strategy,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: use equity-based incentive plans to tie a significant portion of compensation to PerkinElmers long-term results and align the executives financial interests with those of our shareholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: deliver compensation in the aggregate that is commensurate with PerkinElmers results,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: design executive compensation programs that are affordable for the Company, including their impact on earnings,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: design executive incentive plans that do not promote inappropriate or excessive risk taking,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: promote executive ownership of PerkinElmer stock to further align executives financial interests with shareholders interests and to facilitate an ownership culture among executives,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be flexible to respond to changing needs of the business,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consider shareholder feedback, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be transparent, so that both executives and other stakeholders understand the executive compensation program and the objectives it seeks to achieve.

sentences.text: In addition, the committee assesses rewards such as health benefits, retirement programs and perquisites relative to the market.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a strong culture of paying for results.

sentences.text: This is evidenced by the significant percentage of our executive compensation package tied to short- or long-term performance.

sentences.text: In evaluating results against performance metrics and associated achievement, the committee looked primarily at overall corporate financial metrics as an indicator of business performance.

sentences.text: For 2016, the primary metrics were adjusted revenue growth, adjusted operating margin expansion, adjusted gross margin expansion, adjusted earnings per share and free cash flow.

sentences.text: The committee selected these metrics to capture the most important aspects of financial performance in the form of revenue growth, profitability and cash generation.

sentences.text: Revenue growth is a reflection of the growth of our core businesses and expansion through acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profitability and strong cash flow provide us with the means to invest in both product and service innovation as well as business development opportunities that fuel revenue growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the combination of strong top- and bottom-line financial performance and a solid balance sheet create shareholder value growth that is sustainable over the long term.
